awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Lyapunov Exponents and Stable        Manifolds for Stochastic Delay Systems
awd_abstract_narration: The principal investigator will continue to work on                        developing a theory of Lyapunov exponents and stable manifolds                  for stochastic dynamical systems with finite memory.  Such                      dynamical systems occur in many applied sciences as models of                   physical phenomena incorporating the past history of the state                  variables as well as the effects of random fluctuations or noise.               One example would be a hydrodynamic model of blood circulation                  while a second would be a model for population growth.  Small                   random perturbations of deterministic delay models also lead very               naturally to stochastic differential delay systems.  This                       research will lead to discoveries concerning the almost sure                    dynamics of these models.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
